p: The northern part of Bangladesh is comparatively less developed region, and population is usually less conscious about health and has poor practice of preventive measures for infectious diseases. However, in previous sero-prevalence study, the prevalence of dengue was much lower, and most of the positive cases had a history of travelling to the endemic zone, suggesting that the region is non-endemic for dengue [ 18]. This peculiarity of the region has drawn our attention. However, the last dengue epidemic affected the whole country and almost half of the cases were reported from outside of Dhaka city [ 7]. As the hospital where the study was conducted, serves a large portion of population of the Northern Bangladesh, so it was a potential source of data to represent the patients from a non-endemic zone. [ 7].
